intro: Conceveiba latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved Conceveiba, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
